author: Canal 26
title: Delitos electorales en EEUU: investigan el incendio de un buz\u00f3n y tiroteos en Arizona, y robo de boletas en Florida
text: A menos de dos semanas de la jornada electoral, el clima se recalienta en los estados clave para el resultado del 5 de noviembre entre Donald Trump y Kamala Harris. Por Canal26 Jueves 24 de Octubre de 2024 - 17:25 A menos de dos semanas de las [Elecciones en Estados Unidos](https://www.canal26.com/tag/elecciones-en-estados-unidos-2024--12406), las autoridades investigan delitos electorales en dos estados: por un lado, el incendio de un buzón con boletas de voto anticipado y tres ataques a la sede de campaña de [Kamala Harris](https://www.canal26.com/turismo/como-es-oakland-la-ciudad-californiana-en-la-que-nacio-la-candidata-a-presidente-de-eeuu-kamala-harris--396541) en Arizona; y, por otro lado, el robo de boletas electorales en Florida. Por los ataques electorales, en diferentes ciudades de la zona metropolitana de Phoenix, en el condado Maricopa de Arizona, fueron detenidas dos personas. Maricopa es clave para definir quién gana Arizona, donde la vicepresidenta Harris y el expresidente Donald Trump están prácticamente empatados. Te puede interesar: Otra polémica propuesta de Trump: pena de muerte para los inmigrantes que maten a estadounidenses Por un lado, una persona inició un incendio dentro de un buzón del servicio postal UPS en la madrugada de este jueves, dañando al menos 20 boletas electorales, según indicó el capitán de bomberos de Phoenix, Rob McDade. La alcaldesa de Phoenix, Kate Gallego, se mostró preocupada por el incidente y dijo que está trabajando con el secretario de Estado de Arizona, Adrian Fontes, y las autoridades electorales locales para que los votantes afectados puedan emitir su voto nuevamente. Un sospechoso del incendio fue detenido este jueves a la mañana. Otro incidente ocurrió en Phoenix, en donde Jeffrey Michael Kelly, de 60 años, fue acusado este miércoles de tres tiroteos separados en 20 días que dañaron una oficina de campaña del Comité Nacional Demócrata en un suburbio de la capital de Arizona. Las autoridades dijeron que decenas de armas, miles de municiones y un lanzagranadas fueron recuperados de la casa de Kelly, que también está acusado de dejar bolsas de polvo blanco en varios lugares de la ciudad de Temple. La Fiscalía de Maricopa dijo que cree que el sospechoso se estaba preparando para cometer un ataque masivo con las armas que tenía. Te puede interesar: Michael Keaton aseguró que Donald Trump y Elon Musk no respetan a sus seguidores Entretanto, en el centro de Florida, en el condado de Orange, las autoridades investigan el robo de varias boletas de un buzón del USPS supuestamente por una persona que tenía una llave maestra. Se encontraron alrededor de una docena de boletas descartadas cerca de un desagüe pluvial. 1 Turquía: se registraron al menos cuatro muertos y catorce heridos en el ataque terrorista a una fábrica militar en Ankara 2 Xi Jinping pidió "dejar de echar leña al fuego" en Ucrania para terminar la guerra con Rusia 3 Descubrieron el depósito de litio más grande del mundo en Estados Unidos: tendría 40 millones de toneladas 4 La OTAN confirma el despliegue de tropas de Corea del Norte en Rusia y Seúl podría enviar armas a Ucrania 5 Cumbre de los Brics en Rusia: ¿el nacimiento de un Nuevo Orden Mundial? Mantenete siempre informado

author: Lynzie Lowe
title: Jorden Venable named Vacaville PAL Officer of the Year
text: Recognizing her continued work and commitment to the city’s youth, Community Service Officer Jorden Venable has been named the Vacaville Police Department Police Activities League 2023 Officer of the Year. “I feel extremely lucky to be involved with PAL,” said Venable. “The PAL program has become my favorite part of my job and all the kids and teens I get to work with have such amazing spirits. For them to recognize me as PAL Officer of the Year makes me feel like I’m helping make a positive impact in the kids’ lives – but it is definitely a team effort. The PAL staff is phenomenal and I’m so grateful they allow me to be involved.” Youth Development Manager for the Vacaville Police Department Judith Franco said the PAL Officer of the Year is primarily chosen by the teens attending the PAL Teen Center. Franco’s title was announced Dec. 16 following the annual Shop with a Cop breakfast. “We look at attendance and engagement in the PAL program and the impact that they make in the lives of PAL youth,” said Franco. “Longevity in our program is important when making our selection. Youth must also see the officer as someone who is trustworthy, caring and professional.” According to Franco, the youth who nominated Venable said that even when she’s off duty, she still volunteers her time. “It shows youth that she is dedicated and wants to be around them as much as possible,” said Franco. “Through her consistent engagement in the program, she has demonstrated to the youth that she cares about them and that they can trust her. She inspires youth that she works with to be the best version of themselves. She encourages other officers to participate in PAL and brings in her amazing attitude and sense of humor to the program.” According to PAL officials, Venable has helped chaperone many PAL events and is a regular fixture at group meetings and PAL leadership conferences and training trips. “She’s provided friendship and mentorship to a variety of local youth, often devoting much of her own free time and resources to assist,” said PAL officials. “She was an overwhelming selection by the members of the PAL youth groups.” Venable, a Vacaville native, attended high school in Texas but moved back to her hometown shortly after graduating to attend Solano Community College. While attending school, Venable said she did not know what career path she wanted to pursue. She was, however, familiar with the field of law enforcement because her father served as a Vacaville Police Officer. To see if she would like working in that field, Venable joined the Vacaville Police Cadet Program while in college. “Although I didn’t feel being a sworn officer was the best journey for me, I’ve enjoyed being a Community Service Officer and feel it places me in a position to help make an impact in our community,” said Venable. “I’m able to help people on their bad days and serve as a mentor for various youth in our community through programs such as PAL and the police cadets.” Venable said she likes to participate in events like Fiesta Days, National Night Out and Shop with a Cop. “I feel these events provide the police department with opportunities to connect with the community in positive ways and open new avenues of communication,” said Venable. For more information about the Vacaville PAL Program, visit vacavillepal.com/.

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: France | A mother and son who were skiing died in an avalanche - Pledge Times
text: The family was skiing near the Swiss border. British A 54-year-old woman and her 22-year-old son were killed in an avalanche in France near the Saint-Gervais ski resort on Thursday. The mother and son were skiing near the Swiss border when they were buried by an avalanche around 3:30 p.m. local time on Thursday. The British Broadcasting Corporation reports on the matter [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67840309). The mother and son were part of a group of five skiers, which included members of the same family and a guide the family had known for years. Avalanche started near the resort of Saint-Gervais at an altitude of about 2,300 meters. According to local authorities, the avalanche moved about 400 meters. A group of skiers higher up on the slope is suspected to be the trigger. The victims were found after about five hours of searching. Two helicopters and 20 people belonging to the first aid team were involved in the search. The victims were found lifeless and buried in the snow. The guide accompanying the family reportedly had an avalanche warning device, which is used to locate people caught in an avalanche. However, none of the family members had one. In France, about 110 people fall into avalanches every year and about 30 people die in avalanches every year. Correction 29.12. 8:11 p.m.: The family's guide had with him a device used to locate people in an avalanche, apparently not an avalanche warning device as the story said earlier. #France #mother #son #skiing #died #avalanche

author: Ryan Blakely
title: Moberly airport hosts over 30 planes for 47th annual Air Race Classic
text:
MOBERLY — More than 30 planes flew in and out of Omar N. Bradley Regional Airport in Moberly for the sixth stop in the 47th annual Air Race Classic.
Forty-seven aircrafts are still in the race, which spans approximately 2,400 miles across the country. The race is exclusively for teams of two women pilots with ages ranging from 17 to the oldest pilot at 95 years old.
The race is classified as a handicapped race, meaning there are planes of different types and speeds, and each type of plane is assigned a handicap speed. Each team's goal is to beat their plane's handicap speed by the most. The team who beats their plane handicap speed by the most is the winner.
"That system allows all of us to race together, which has been a really, really exciting time," said Piper aircraft pilot Carly Shukiar.
Piper aircraft pilots Carly Schukiar (right) and Lucy Freeman (left) prepare their plane for the journey to Oklahoma at the airport in Moberly during the 2024 Air Race Classic.
Ryan Blakely, KOMU 8 Reporter Along with trying to record a fast time, pilots also share another goal: to be an inspiration for young girls in aviation.

author: Vactor20
title: #2 Los Telegram sado del feminista Errejón a su amante: 'Zorra, ¿Vienes a que te ordene'?
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#1](c1#c-1) A mi dos adultos de manera libre lo que hagan en la cama me la pela.
[#0](c0#c-0) Basura no, por favor.
[#9](c9#c-9). No es nada personal y si Errejón acaba siendo investigado, juzgado y declarado culpable entonces es posible que esos mensajes privados alcancen una notoriedad pública justificable.
[#0](c0#c-0). Voto sensacionalista. Esto ni es información ni es nada. El tipo ya ha dimitido y probablemente tenga un proceso judicial por delante, que ya se verá si el tema progresa o queda en nada. Que venga ahora la derecha española "a hacer leña del arbol caido" además de aburrir no aporta absolutamente nada.
La vida privada de los políticos, incluidas sus telecomunicaciones, son privadas. Si ni tan siquiera somos capaces de respetar eso cualquiera de nosotros puede acabar despotricado en un meneo por absolutamente cualquier cosa.
No lo voy a defender, porque no se que ha hecho o dejado de hacer, pero si eso es todo ... La gente es muy inculta con el tema sado...
